channel.title: Research on AI Freedom Stack
channel.description: Recent content in Research on AI Freedom Stack

item.title: Gemini (Google)
item.description:
What is Gemini?

Google’s AI platform, powered by the Gemini model family. The killer feature is context — 1M+ tokens means you can feed it entire books, codebases, or research papers. Comes with built-in Google Search, image generation (Imagen), and tight integration with Google Workspace.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Researchers, content creators processing large documents, anyone in Google’s ecosystem
  • Not for: People who need the best writing quality (Claude) or the most versatile tool (ChatGPT)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 Gemini Pro, image gen, web search, generous limits
Advanced $20/mo 1M+ context, Workspace integration, Gemini Ultra
API Pay-per-token Pro: free tier available, Ultra from ~$1.25/M input

Hidden costs: The $20/mo bundles with Google One (2TB storage), which is actually decent value if you need cloud storage anyway.

item.title: Perplexity
item.description:
What is Perplexity?

A search engine that uses AI to synthesize real answers from the web, with citations. Ask it anything and it gives you a sourced summary instead of making you click through links. Pro tier adds access to Claude, GPT-4, and deeper analysis.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Researchers, content creators, anyone who googles things more than 5 times a day
  • Not for: People who need creative writing, coding help, or image generation (use Claude/Cursor for those)
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ (5/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
Free $0 Unlimited quick searches, 5 Pro searches/day
Pro $20/mo 600+ Pro searches/day, model choice, file uploads

Hidden costs: None, really. One of the more transparent pricing models.

item.title: Tools for AI-Powered Research
item.description:
Tools for AI-Powered Research

Use AI to research faster, synthesize information from multiple sources, and produce well-sourced analysis.

Deep Research & Synthesis

  • Claude — Best for long-form analysis and synthesis. 200K token context window lets you feed entire documents and get comprehensive summaries. Projects feature stores research context across conversations.
  • Kimi K2.5 — Massive context window for processing large documents. Strong at multi-source synthesis.
  • Perplexity AI — AI search engine that cites its sources. Good for initial research and fact-finding. Free tier is useful; Pro unlocks more powerful models.

Document Processing

  • Whisper (local) — Transcribe interviews, podcasts, lectures, and meetings. Run locally for free with Ollama.
  • NotebookLM (Google) — Upload documents and chat with them. Auto-generates summaries, FAQs, and audio overviews.

Knowledge Management

  • Obsidian — Local-first note-taking with bidirectional linking. Build a personal knowledge graph from your research. Pairs beautifully with Ollama for local AI chat about your notes.
  • Logseq — Open-source alternative to Obsidian. Outline-based. Good for daily journals and block-level references.

Data Analysis

  • Claude — Upload CSVs and get analysis, charts, and insights. Artifacts feature renders visualizations inline.
  • Julius AI — Purpose-built for data analysis. Upload spreadsheets, ask questions in plain English, get charts and statistical analysis.

Citation & Writing

  • Zotero — Free, open-source reference manager. Essential for academic or well-sourced writing.
  • Claude — Draft research reports, literature reviews, and analysis from your collected sources.

Recommended Workflow

  1. Discover — Use Perplexity to survey a topic and collect initial sources
  2. Collect — Save sources to Zotero, transcribe audio with Whisper
  3. Process — Feed documents to Claude or Kimi for synthesis and analysis
  4. Connect — Store insights in Obsidian, link related concepts
  5. Produce — Draft final output with Claude, citing your sources

item.title: Kimi K2.5
item.description:
What is Kimi K2.5?

Kimi K2.5 is a trillion-parameter AI model from Beijing-based Moonshot AI. It uses a Mixture of Experts architecture — 384 expert modules, only 32 billion active per query — giving you frontier-level intelligence at efficient compute costs. Its standout feature is Agent Swarm: native multi-agent task decomposition for complex research.

Who is it for?

  • Best for: Researchers, analysts, and builders who need deep multi-source research and competitive intelligence
  • Not for: Casual chatbot use or everyday questions — stick with ChatGPT for that
  • Solo builder score: ⭐⭐⭐⭐☆ (4/5)

What does it cost?

Plan Price What You Get
API Pay-per-token Full trillion-parameter model
Open Weights Free 171B parameter version on HuggingFace

Hidden costs: The open weights version requires serious hardware to self-host (171B parameters).
